data.desc:
## Summary

Building block for request-based data providers with recovery logic; supports recovery with a single request

## Connectors

### Input/Output Connector `makeDataProviderRequestConnector`

This connector makes a request using the input data for the request body.

### Input/Output Connector `makeDataProviderRequestFromConfigConnector`

This connector makes a request using configuration to provide the request body.

Local data for the call to `UserApi::expandTemplatedValue()` is the input argument data for the connector available as `$local:input`.

### Input/Output Connector `DataProvider Request Validation`

This connector is suitable for step validation logic; it returns a string providing the validation status, either `COMPLETE` or `RETRY`, depending if output data was found in the output data provider or not.

The input data is available as `$local:input` for all config items resolved with this connector (in internal calls to `UserApi::expandTemplatedValue()`).
data.name: BBM_DataProviderRequestWithRecovery
data.display_name: BBM Data Provider Request With Recovery
author: Qore Technologies, s.r.o.

configItems.name: dataprovider-request-recovery-provider-path
configItems.description: the path to the data provider to use for the request

configItems.name: dataprovider-request-recovery-input
configItems.description: the input value for the recovery request; either this item or *dataprovider-request-recovery-mapper* must be provided to specify the request body

configItems.name: dataprovider-request-recovery-mapper
configItems.description: the name of the mapper; either this item or *dataprovider-request-recovery-input* must be provided to specify the request body

configItems.name: dataprovider-request-recovery-options
configItems.description: any options for the recovery request

configItems.name: dataprovider-request-recovery-id-location
configItems.description: location in the response for the unique ID; `-` means the entire response is the ID; if this config item is set, and no value is found in the response at the location given here, an exception is thrown

configItems.name: dataprovider-request-recovery-body-remove-nulls
configItems.description: if true then any empty key values in the request body will be removed before sending the request to the server

configItems.name: dataprovider-request-recovery-output-data
configItems.description: the configuration of output data; the response hash is passed as input to the `UserApi::updateOutputData()` method; if the response is not a hash itself, it will be available in the `value` key of the output data passed to this method

configItems.description: a string giving a log message for successful retrieval of the ID identified by *dataprovider-request-recovery-id-location*; this ID can be referred to as `$local:{response-id}` in the template string

configItems.name: dataprovider-request-provider-path

configItems.name: dataprovider-request-input
configItems.description: the input value for the request; either this item or *dataprovider-request-mapper* must be provided to specify the request body

configItems.name: dataprovider-request-body-remove-nulls

## Summary

Reverse HTTP proxy building block for use in a Qorus service.

Provides HTTP and also WebSocket proxying functionality; also chunked transfers are forwarded directly as well.

There are no connectors; this building block class is driven entirely by configuration.
data.name: BBM_HttpReverseProxyService
author: Qore Technologies, s.r.o.

configItems.name: http-listener-bind-address
configItems.description: optional bind address for a dedicated listener; if not set, then it will bind on all Qorus system listeners as a global handler

configItems.name: http-listener-cert-location
configItems.description: optional X.509 certificate location name for a dedicated listener; location resolved with `UserApi::getTextFileFromLocation()` or `UserApi::getBinaryFileFromLocation()` depending on the value of `http-listener-cert-format` (ex: `file://$OMQ_DIR/user/certs/my-cert.pem`)

configItems.name: http-listener-cert-format
configItems.description:
possible values giving the format of the data defined by `http-listener-cert-location`:
- **`PEM`**: PEM format (text)
- **`DER`**: DER format (binary)
- **`AUTO`**: try to determine the format automatically

configItems.name: http-listener-key-location
configItems.description: optional private key resource name for a dedicated listener; location resolved with `UserApi::getTextFileFromLocation()` or `UserApi::getBinaryFileFromLocation()` depending on the value of `http-listener-key-format` (ex: `file://$OMQ_DIR/user/certs/my-key.pem`)

configItems.name: http-listener-key-format
configItems.description:
possible values giving the format of the data defined by `http-listener-key-location`:
- **`PEM`**: PEM format (text)
- **`DER`**: DER format (binary)
- **`AUTO`**: try to determine the format automatically

configItems.name: http-listener-key-password
configItems.description: optional password to PEM private key data for a dedicated listener

configItems.name: http-listener-ssl-mode
configItems.description: set the SSL mode

configItems.name: http-listener-accept-all-certs
configItems.description: flag to accept all client certificates

configItems.name: http-listener-capture-client-certs
configItems.description: flag to capture client certificates

configItems.name: http-root-uri
configItems.description: The root URI path for the HTTP service

configItems.name: http-root-uri-is-regex
configItems.description: set to true if 'root-uri' is a regular expression pattern

configItems.name: http-auth-name
configItems.description:
A string identifying the authenticator; the following values are allowed:
 - **`default`**: the default Qorus authenticator; new connections must have valid credentials for Qorus
 - **`default-basic`**: the same as **`default`** except in case of an unauthorized request, a `WWW-Authenticate` header is returned indicating that HTTP basic authentication is required
 - **`permissive`**: no authentication is required; all requests are automatically accepted
 - **`cookie`**: same as `default` with also support for cookie-based authentication; the cookie name is defined with the `http-auth-cookie` config item

configItems.name: http-auth-cookie
configItems.description: A string providing the name of the cookie for cookie-based authentication, only used when `http-auth-name` is `cookie`

configItems.name: http-auth-redirect
configItems.description: A string providing the URL to redirect unauthenticated requests; only used when `http-auth-name` is `cookie`

configItems.name: http-match-content-types
configItems.description: an optional list of string content types that will cause external requests to match this handler

configItems.name: http-match-headers
configItems.description: an optional list of string header names (in lower case) that will cause external requests with those headers to match this handler

configItems.name: http-cors-enable
configItems.description: set to `true` to enable CORS

configItems.name: http-cors-methods
configItems.description: HTTP methods allowed with CORS; ignored if `http-cors-enable` is `false`

configItems.name: http-cors-max-age
configItems.description: the value for the `Access-Control-Max-Age` header

configItems.name: http-cors-headers
configItems.description: values for the `Access-Control-Allow-Headers` header

configItems.name: http-cors-credentials
configItems.description: if `true` then the `Access-Control-Allow-Credentials: true` header is sent

configItems.name: http-reverse-proxy-target
configItems.description: The URL target for the reverse proxy

configItems.name: http-reverse-proxy-client-timeout-ms
configItems.description: The timeout in MS for answers from the reverse proxy target server

configItems.name: http-reverse-proxy-request-strip-headers
configItems.description: A list of headers to strip from client requests when forwarding to the server

configItems.name: http-reverse-proxy-request-add-headers
configItems.description: A hash of headers to add to client requests when forwarding to the server

configItems.name: http-reverse-proxy-response-strip-headers
configItems.description: A list of headers to strip from server responses when forwarding to the client

configItems.name: http-reverse-proxy-response-add-headers
configItems.description: A hash of headers to add to server responses when forwarding to the client

configItems.name: http-reverse-proxy-client-override-host
configItems.description:
Set to `true` if the `Host` header should be overridden in requests to the
target

configItems.name: http-listener-allow-sharing
configItems.description: allow multiple Qorus services to bind handlers to the same listener

data.desc:
## Summary 

Building block job base class for polling for files from an FTP server and creating a workflow order from files polled.

The local context data for the internal workflow order creation call is the file event data as described by data type `qoretechnologies/building-blocks/ftp/event`; therefore this information can be used when creating the order; for example `create-workflow-staticdata` = `$local:*` would set the initial static order data to the file event hash.

Duplicates can be detected if detected from order keys, i.e. if one of the following config items is used: 
- `create-workflow-specific-unique-key`
- `create-workflow-unique-key`
- `create-workflow-global-unique-key`

In this case this object also contains configuration that allows for an alternative "duplicate-file-handling" workflow order to be created.  See config items in the **FTP Polling Workflow Creation Duplicate File Handling** group for more information.

**Note** The `ftp-polling-interval-secs` config item is always ignored in this class; this class must be used as the base class for a job, and the job's schedule determines the polling interval.
data.name: BBM_FtpPollerCreateOrderJob
data.display_name: BBM Ftp Poller Create Order Job
author: Qore Technologies, s.r.o.

configItems.name: ftp-polling-duplicate-file-connection
configItems.description: "the name of a local file connection where to save duplicate files; "ftp-polling-duplicate-file-name" can be set to give a subdirectory path offset from the connection"
configItems.config_group: FTP Polling Workflow Creation Duplicate File Handling

configItems.name: ftp-polling-duplicate-name-template
configItems.description: "the filename template for the target file when moving duplicate files; only used if "ftp-polling-file-connection" and "ftp-polling-duplicate-file-connection" are set; the filesystem event info is available in the local context; this configuration item can also be used to provide a subdirectory from the file connection in which to store duplicate files"
configItems.config_group: FTP Polling Workflow Creation Duplicate File Handling

configItems.name: ftp-polling-duplicate-workflow-name
configItems.description: "the name of the workflow for duplicate file handling; if not set (the default), no workflow order will be created; only used if "ftp-polling-file-connection" and "ftp-polling-duplicate-order-mapper" are also set"
configItems.config_group: FTP Polling Workflow Creation Duplicate File Handling

configItems.name: ftp-polling-duplicate-workflow-version
configItems.description: the version of the workflow for duplicate file handling; if not set (the default), the latest version will be used"
configItems.config_group: FTP Polling Workflow Creation Duplicate File Handling

configItems.name: ftp-polling-duplicate-order-mapper
configItems.description: "the mapper for creating duplicate orders, only used if "ftp-polling-file-connection" and "ftp-polling-duplicate-order-mapper" are also set; the local file path is available as "$local:local_path" and if "ftp-polling-duplicate-file-connection" is set, then the new name is available as "$local:new_name""
configItems.config_group: FTP Polling Workflow Creation Duplicate File Handling

data.desc:
## Summary

Generic building block class for polling for files from an SFTP server.

This class is meant to be used as a base class for interfaces (normally a job or a service) that provide SFTP polling as an event connector.

If config item `sftp-polling-file-connection` is set, then files are streamed efficiently to the given local file system location and not stored in memory.  If this config item is not set, then all files are transferred and stored in main memory, which can cause problems with very large files.

If uploads to the SFTP server are not atomic, the `sftp-polling-minage` config item can be used to ensure that files are only polled after they have been present on the FTP server for a defined period of time, which should be greater than the maximum time required to transfer the largest files.

Note that this class can be used in either a job or a service to provide regular polling for files from an SFTP server.  Use in a job is encouraged, as the job schedule is easily controlled by operational users and is the pollijng schedule, additionally the results of each polling operation are exposed in the UI and in the API as job results, making it easier to monitor the SFTP polling status.

## Connectors

### Input/Output Connector `pollForFiles`

Used to poll for files once and return file data as output for all files polled.  Input data is ignored.

### Input/Output Connector `start`

This connector can be used in a service to poll in a service's `start()` method in a background thread.  In order to use this class's `sftpFileEvent` connector, this connector must be used as the service's `start()` method.

Input data is ignored and passed through to the output data.

### Input/Output Connector `stop`

This connector can be used in a service to stop polling in a service's `stop()` method.   In order to use this class's `sftpFileEvent` connector, this connector must be used as the service's `stop()` method.

Input data is ignored and passed through to the output data.

### Event Connector `sftpFileEvent`

This event connector can be used in a service to process file events once they have been polled and fully transferred to the server.  In order to use this connector, the `start` and `stop` connectors must be used in a service's `start()` and `stop()` methods to start and stop the polling thread, respectively.

## References

See:
- class building block: `BBM_SftpPollerCreateOrder`
- job base class: `BBM_SftpPollerCreateOrderJob`
data.name: BBM_SftpPollerBase
author: Qore Technologies, s.r.o.

configItems.name: sftp-polling-connection-name
configItems.description: the name of the SFTP connection

configItems.name: sftp-polling-mask
configItems.description: the filename mask for files to match when polling; is a regular expression if `sftp-polling-mask-regex` is set; if not, then this value is a glob value

configItems.name: sftp-polling-mask-regex
configItems.description: if `sftp-polling-mask` is a regular expression or not

configItems.name: sftp-polling-regex-options
configItems.description: regular expression options for SFTP polling; only used if `sftp-polling-mask-regex` is true

configItems.name: sftp-polling-interval-secs
configItems.description:
The polling interval in seconds for when this class is used in a service with the `start` and `stop` and `sftpFileEvent` connectors.

This config item is only used when this class is used in the background polling thread in a Qorus service with the above-mentioned connectors; it is ignored in all other cases.

configItems.name: sftp-polling-file-connection
configItems.description: the name of a local file connection where to save files; `sftp-polling-file-name` can be set to give a subdirectory path offset from the connection; note that if this configuration item is not set, then files are retrieved to memory, this should only be done for relatively small files; if files can be large, then it's recommended to set this option and process files directly from the filesystem

configItems.name: sftp-polling-file-name
configItems.description: a template string giving the target local file name as offset from the connection identified with `sftp-polling-file-connection`; ignored if `sftp-polling-file-connection` is not set; local context includes the event information (ex: `subdir/$local:name`)

configItems.name: sftp-polling-file-temp-template
configItems.description: the template for the temporary filename used while transferring the file, the file event info is added to the local context (ex: the target filename is available as `$local:name`)

configItems.name: sftp-polling-minage
configItems.description: the minimum age of the file in seconds before it will be visible to the poller

configItems.name: sftp-polling-encoding
configItems.description: the character encoding for any text files received

configItems.name: sftp-polling-delete-file
configItems.description: if true then files will be deleted after the polling action has been executed on them; if false then `sftp-polling-move-target` must be set

configItems.name: sftp-polling-move-target
configItems.description: the directory and target filename for moving / renaming files after the polling action has been executed, only used if `sftp-polling-delete-file` is false; file event info is added to the local context (ex: `complete/$local:{name}`)"

data.desc:
## Summary

Building block for creating a workflow order from configuration.

This building block uses configuration to create the new workflow order; for a building block that binds purely based on input data, see `BBM_CreateOrder`

**NOTE**:  This building block's functionality has been superceded by an API (request - response) data provider; it's recommended to use the `workflows/create-order` API data provider in the `qorus-api` factory instead

## Connectors

### Input/Output Connector `createOrderStatic`

Create the workflow order based on configuration.
The input data is available as `$local:input` for all config items resolved with this connector (in internal calls to `UserApi::expandTemplatedValue()`).
data.name: BBM_CreateOrderStatic
author: Qore Technologies, s.r.o.

configItems.name: create-workflow-name
configItems.description: the name of the workflow

configItems.name: create-workflow-version
configItems.description: the version of the workflow; if not set (the default), the latest version will be used

configItems.name: create-workflow-order-mapper
configItems.description: the name of the mapper to create the workflow order data

configItems.name: create-workflow-duplicate-handling
configItems.description:
how should workflows with duplicate unique keys be handled:
 - `SUCCESS`: the workflow order instance ID is returned normally
 - `DUPLICATE`: the `DUPLICATE-ORDER-KEY` exception is rethrown

configItems.name: create-workflow-output-data
configItems.description:
the configuration of output data for `UserApi::updateOutputData()`; the output data will include a `workflow_instanceid` key with the ID created for the new workflow order and a `duplicate` key with a boolean value indicating if the order is a duplicate order (only `True` if `create-workflow-duplicate-handling` = `SUCCESS`

Values should have the format:
`data: location`

For example:
```
workflow_instanceid: '$dynamic:order-id'
```
Will store the `workflow_instanceid` of the order created in the `order-id` key in workflow dynamic data.

configItems.name: create-workflow-order-status
configItems.description: override any status information in the order data

configItems.name: create-workflow-staticdata
configItems.description: A hash providing the initial workflow order static data

configItems.name: create-workflow-sensitivedata
configItems.description: An optional hash providing the initial workflow order sensitive data

configItems.name: create-workflow-dynamicdata
configItems.description: An optional hash providing the initial workflow order dynamic data

configItems.name: create-workflow-tempdata
configItems.description: An optional hash providing the initial workflow order temporary / scratch data

configItems.name: create-workflow-external-id
configItems.description: An optional external order ID; not a unique key for the order; use order keys for generic order key references

configItems.name: create-workflow-order-keys
configItems.description: An optional hash of order keys; the keys in this hash must correspond to registered workflow order keys, the values are one or more key values. These keys can be used to quickly search for workflow order data

configItems.name: create-workflow-specific-unique-key
configItems.description:
An optional hash of order keys that will ensure uniqueness for a particular workflow (workflowid or name and version); the keys in this hash must correspond to registered workflow order keys, the values are one or more key values.  These keys can be used to quickly search for workflow order data.
If a workflow order for the same exact workflow (workflowid) has one of the given key/value combinations already, then the workflow order creation duplicate logic will be triggered.

configItems.name: create-workflow-unique-key
configItems.description:
An optional hash of order keys that will ensure uniqueness for a particular workflow name (across all versions); the keys in this hash must correspond to registered workflow order keys, the values are one or more key values. These keys can be used to quickly search for workflow order data.
If a workflow order for the same workflow name (across all version) has one of the given key/value combinations already, then the workflow order creation duplicate logic will be triggered.

configItems.name: create-workflow-global-unique-key
configItems.description:
An optional hash of order keys that will ensure uniqueness across all workflows in the given Qorus instance; the keys in this hash must correspond to registered workflow order keys, the values are one or more key values. These keys can be used to quickly search for workflow order data.
If a workflow order already exists with one of the given key/value combinations already, then the workflow order creation duplicate logic will be triggered.

configItems.name: create-workflow-parent-workflow-id
configItems.description: An optional parent workflow order instance ID to provide a loosely-coupled parent-child relationship for the new order

configItems.name: create-workflow-priority
configItems.description: The workflow order priority value from 0 - 999; priority 0 is the highest; 999 is the lowest

configItems.name: create-workflow-scheduled
configItems.description: The workflow order scheduled date; if this value is set, then the order cannot be processed before the given date/time value

## Summary 

Building block class for polling for files from an FTP server and creating a workflow order from files polled.

The local context data for the internal workflow order creation call is the file event data as described by data type `qoretechnologies/building-blocks/ftp/event`; therefore this information can be used when creating the order; for example `create-workflow-staticdata` = `$local:*` would set the initial static order data to the file event hash.

Duplicates can be detected if detected from order keys, i.e. if one of the following config items is used: 
- `create-workflow-specific-unique-key`
- `create-workflow-unique-key`
- `create-workflow-global-unique-key`

In this case this object also contains configuration that allows for an alternative "duplicate-file-handling" workflow order to be created.  See config items in the **FTP Polling Workflow Creation Duplicate File Handling** group for more information.

## References

See `BBM_FtpPollerCreateOrderJob` for a class designed to be used as the base class for a job
data.name: BBM_FtpPollerCreateOrder
author: Qore Technologies, s.r.o.

configItems.name: ftp-polling-connection-name
configItems.description: the name of the FTP connection

configItems.name: ftp-polling-mask
configItems.description: "the filename mask for files to match when polling; is a regular expression if \"ftp-polling-mask-regex\" is set; if not, then this value is a glob value"

configItems.name: ftp-polling-mask-regex
configItems.description: if "ftp-polling-mask" is a regular expression or not

configItems.name: ftp-polling-regex-options
configItems.description: "regular expression options for FTP polling; only used if \"ftp-polling-mask-regex\" is true"

configItems.name: ftp-polling-file-connection
configItems.description: the name of a local file connection where to save files; \"ftp-polling-file-name\" can be set to give a subdirectory path offset from the connection; note that if this configuration item is not set, then files are retrieved to memory, this should only be done for relatively small files; if files can be large, then it's recommended to set this option and process files directly from the filesystem

configItems.name: ftp-polling-file-name
configItems.description: "a template string giving the target local file name as offset from the connection identified with \"ftp-polling-file-connection\"; ignored if \"ftp-polling-file-connection\" is not set; local context includes the event information (ex: \"subdir/$local:name\")"

configItems.name: ftp-polling-file-temp-template
configItems.description: "the template for the temporary filename used while transferring the file, the file event info is added to the local context (ex: the target filename is available as $local:name)"

configItems.name: ftp-polling-minage
configItems.description: the minimum age of the file in seconds before it will be visible to the poller

configItems.name: ftp-polling-encoding
configItems.description: the character encoding for any text files received

configItems.name: ftp-polling-delete-file
configItems.description: if true then files will be deleted after the polling action has been executed on them; if false then \"ftp-polling-move-directory\" must be set

configItems.name: ftp-polling-move-target
configItems.description: "the directory and target filename for moving / renaming files after the polling action has been executed, only used if \"ftp-polling-delete-file\" is false; file event info is added to the local context (ex: \"complete/$local:{name}\")"

configItems.name: ftp-polling-duplicate-file-connection
configItems.description: "the name of a local file connection where to save duplicate files; "ftp-polling-duplicate-file-name" can be set to give a subdirectory path offset from the connection"
configItems.config_group: FTP Polling Workflow Creation Duplicate File Handling

configItems.name: ftp-polling-duplicate-name-template
configItems.description: "the filename template for the target file when moving duplicate files; only used if "ftp-polling-file-connection" and "ftp-polling-duplicate-file-connection" are set; the filesystem event info is available in the local context; this configuration item can also be used to provide a subdirectory from the file connection in which to store duplicate files"
configItems.config_group: FTP Polling Workflow Creation Duplicate File Handling

configItems.name: ftp-polling-duplicate-workflow-name
configItems.description: "the name of the workflow for duplicate file handling; if not set (the default), no workflow order will be created; only used if "ftp-polling-file-connection" and "ftp-polling-duplicate-order-mapper" are also set"
configItems.config_group: FTP Polling Workflow Creation Duplicate File Handling

configItems.name: ftp-polling-duplicate-workflow-version
configItems.description: the version of the workflow for duplicate file handling; if not set (the default), the latest version will be used"
configItems.config_group: FTP Polling Workflow Creation Duplicate File Handling

configItems.name: ftp-polling-duplicate-order-mapper
configItems.description: "the mapper for creating duplicate orders, only used if "ftp-polling-file-connection" and "ftp-polling-duplicate-order-mapper" are also set; the local file path is available as "$local:local_path" and if "ftp-polling-duplicate-file-connection" is set, then the new name is available as "$local:new_name""
configItems.config_group: FTP Polling Workflow Creation Duplicate File Handling

configItems.name: ftp-polling-interval-secs
configItems.description:
The polling interval in seconds for when this class is used in a service with the `start` and `stop` and `ftpFileEvent` connectors.

This config item is only used when this class is used in the background polling thread in a Qorus service with the above-mentioned connectors; it is ignored in all other cases.

configItems.name: create-workflow-output-data
configItems.description:
the configuration of output data for `UserApi::updateOutputData()`; the output data will include a `workflow_instanceid` key with the ID created for the new workflow order and a `duplicate` key with a boolean value indicating if the order is a duplicate order (only `True` if `create-workflow-duplicate-handling` = `SUCCESS`

Values should have the format:
`data: location`

For example:
```
workflow_instanceid: '$dynamic:order-id'
```
Will store the `workflow_instanceid` of the order created in the `order-id` key in workflow dynamic data.

configItems.name: create-workflow-order-keys
configItems.description: An optional hash of order keys; the keys in this hash must correspond to registered workflow order keys, the values are one or more key values. These keys can be used to quickly search for workflow order data

configItems.name: create-workflow-specific-unique-key
configItems.description:
An optional hash of order keys that will ensure uniqueness for a particular workflow (workflowid or name and version); the keys in this hash must correspond to registered workflow order keys, the values are one or more key values.  These keys can be used to quickly search for workflow order data.
If a workflow order for the same exact workflow (workflowid) has one of the given key/value combinations already, then the workflow order creation duplicate logic will be triggered.

configItems.name: create-workflow-unique-key
configItems.description:
An optional hash of order keys that will ensure uniqueness for a particular workflow name (across all versions); the keys in this hash must correspond to registered workflow order keys, the values are one or more key values. These keys can be used to quickly search for workflow order data.
If a workflow order for the same workflow name (across all version) has one of the given key/value combinations already, then the workflow order creation duplicate logic will be triggered.

configItems.name: create-workflow-global-unique-key
configItems.description:
An optional hash of order keys that will ensure uniqueness across all workflows in the given Qorus instance; the keys in this hash must correspond to registered workflow order keys, the values are one or more key values. These keys can be used to quickly search for workflow order data.
If a workflow order already exists with one of the given key/value combinations already, then the workflow order creation duplicate logic will be triggered.

configItems.name: create-workflow-parent-workflow-id
configItems.description: An optional parent workflow order instance ID to provide a loosely-coupled parent-child relationship for the new order

configItems.name: create-workflow-priority

## Summary

This is a generic mapper class building block that can be used to make generic data transformations.

## Connectors

### Input/Output Connector `map`

This connector uses the configured mapper to transform the input data; the output data is the result of the map operation.

Input data is available as `$local:input` when resolving config items with this connector.

Note that input data used for the mapper is always the connector input data if present.

### Input/Output Connector `mapFromConfig`

This connector uses the configured mapper to transform the input data; the output data is the result of the map operation.

Note that input data used for the mapper is always taken from the `automapper-input` config item; input data is only used as context data (i.e. as `$local:input`) when resolving config item template values.

## Summary

Base class for running a mapper in autonomous mode, meaning that the input and output data are provided by data providers configured in the mapper.

This building block is not suitable for mapping input data and returning output data, for that use `BBM_GenericMapper` or a mapper in an FSM, a data pipeline, or in a class connection in an interface.

Use this object's configuration to provide input or search filtering as well as to tune the output data handling.

## Connectors

### Input/Output Connector `runMapper`

This connector runs the mapper in autonomous mode.

The input data is available as `$local:input` for all config items resolved with this connector (in internal calls to `UserApi::expandTemplatedValue()`).

## References

See `BBM_GenericMapper`

## Summary 

Building block job base class for polling for files from an SFTP server and creating a workflow order from files polled.

The local context data for the internal workflow order creation call is the file event data as described by data type `qoretechnologies/building-blocks/sftp/event`; therefore this information can be used when creating the order; for example `create-workflow-staticdata` = `$local:*` would set the initial static order data to the file event hash.

Duplicates can be detected from order keys, i.e. if one of the following config items is used: 
- `create-workflow-specific-unique-key`
- `create-workflow-unique-key`
- `create-workflow-global-unique-key`

In this case this object also contains configuration that allows for an alternative "duplicate-file-handling" workflow order to be created.  See config items in the **SFTP Polling Workflow Creation Duplicate File Handling** group for more information.

**Note** The `sftp-polling-interval-secs` config item is always ignored in this class; this class must be used as the base class for a job, and the job's schedule determines the polling interval.

## Connectors

### Input/Output Connector `runJob`

Runs the poll action once.
data.name: BBM_SftpPollerCreateOrderJob
data.display_name: BBM Sftp Poller Create Order Job
author: Qore Technologies, s.r.o.

configItems.name: create-workflow-name
configItems.description:
The name of the workflow.

For resolving template values `$local:input` is a hash with the following values:

- `name` (string): the name of the file polled
- `size` (int): the size of the file in bytes
- `uid` (int): the UID of the owner of the file
- `gid` (int): the GID of the owner of the file
- `mode` (string): the permissions / mode of the file
- `atime` (date): the last accessed date/time of the file
- `mtime` (date): the last modified date/time of the file
- `type` (string): the type of file; one of: `REGULAR`, `DIRECTORY`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `BLOCK-DEVICE`, `CHARACTER-DEVICE`, `FIFO`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `SOCKET`, or `UNKNOWN`
- `perm` (string): a string giving UNIX-style permissions for the file (ex: `-rwxr-xr-x`)
- `data` (binary): this key is only present if `sftp-polling-file-connection` not set; in this case the remote file data is retrieved in memory and stored in this key as binary data
- `filepath` (string): the remote filepath relative to SFTP root directory
- `order_status` (string): the status of the new order created (`READY` or `BLOCKED`)
- `workflow_instanceid` (int): the ID of the new workflow order
- `duplicate` (bool): a boolean value indicating if the order is a duplicate order (only `True` if `create-workflow-duplicate-handling` = `SUCCESS`)

If `sftp-polling-file-connection` is set, the `$local:input` includes the following keys:
- `local_path` (string): the target path for the file where the file will be moved to in the post event action
- `tmp_filename` (string): the temporary filename used to store the file until the post action
- `tmp_path` (string): the current temporary path on the filesystem of the file
- `transfer_time` (date): a relative date/time value giving the time it took to transfer the file

configItems.name: create-workflow-version
configItems.description:
The version of the workflow; if not set (the default), the latest version will be used.

For resolving template values `$local:input` is a hash with the following values:

- `name` (string): the name of the file polled
- `size` (int): the size of the file in bytes
- `uid` (int): the UID of the owner of the file
- `gid` (int): the GID of the owner of the file
- `mode` (string): the permissions / mode of the file
- `atime` (date): the last accessed date/time of the file
- `mtime` (date): the last modified date/time of the file
- `type` (string): the type of file; one of: `REGULAR`, `DIRECTORY`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `BLOCK-DEVICE`, `CHARACTER-DEVICE`, `FIFO`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `SOCKET`, or `UNKNOWN`
- `perm` (string): a string giving UNIX-style permissions for the file (ex: `-rwxr-xr-x`)
- `data` (binary): this key is only present if `sftp-polling-file-connection` not set; in this case the remote file data is retrieved in memory and stored in this key as binary data
- `filepath` (string): the remote filepath relative to SFTP root directory
- `order_status` (string): the status of the new order created (`READY` or `BLOCKED`)
- `workflow_instanceid` (int): the ID of the new workflow order
- `duplicate` (bool): a boolean value indicating if the order is a duplicate order (only `True` if `create-workflow-duplicate-handling` = `SUCCESS`)

If `sftp-polling-file-connection` is set, the `$local:input` includes the following keys:
- `local_path` (string): the target path for the file where the file will be moved to in the post event action
- `tmp_filename` (string): the temporary filename used to store the file until the post action
- `tmp_path` (string): the current temporary path on the filesystem of the file
- `transfer_time` (date): a relative date/time value giving the time it took to transfer the file

configItems.name: create-workflow-order-status
configItems.description:
Override any status information in the order data.

For resolving template values `$local:input` is a hash with the following values:

- `name` (string): the name of the file polled
- `size` (int): the size of the file in bytes
- `uid` (int): the UID of the owner of the file
- `gid` (int): the GID of the owner of the file
- `mode` (string): the permissions / mode of the file
- `atime` (date): the last accessed date/time of the file
- `mtime` (date): the last modified date/time of the file
- `type` (string): the type of file; one of: `REGULAR`, `DIRECTORY`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `BLOCK-DEVICE`, `CHARACTER-DEVICE`, `FIFO`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `SOCKET`, or `UNKNOWN`
- `perm` (string): a string giving UNIX-style permissions for the file (ex: `-rwxr-xr-x`)
- `data` (binary): this key is only present if `sftp-polling-file-connection` not set; in this case the remote file data is retrieved in memory and stored in this key as binary data
- `filepath` (string): the remote filepath relative to SFTP root directory
- `order_status` (string): the status of the new order created (`READY` or `BLOCKED`)
- `workflow_instanceid` (int): the ID of the new workflow order
- `duplicate` (bool): a boolean value indicating if the order is a duplicate order (only `True` if `create-workflow-duplicate-handling` = `SUCCESS`)

If `sftp-polling-file-connection` is set, the `$local:input` includes the following keys:
- `local_path` (string): the target path for the file where the file will be moved to in the post event action
- `tmp_filename` (string): the temporary filename used to store the file until the post action
- `tmp_path` (string): the current temporary path on the filesystem of the file
- `transfer_time` (date): a relative date/time value giving the time it took to transfer the file

configItems.name: sftp-polling-duplicate-file-connection
configItems.description: "the name of a local file connection where to save duplicate files; "sftp-polling-duplicate-file-name" can be set to give a subdirectory path offset from the connection"
configItems.config_group: SFTP Polling Workflow Creation Duplicate File Handling

configItems.name: sftp-polling-duplicate-name-template
configItems.description: "the filename template for the target file when moving duplicate files; only used if "sftp-polling-file-connection" and "sftp-polling-duplicate-file-connection" are set; the filesystem event info is available in the local context; this configuration item can also be used to provide a subdirectory from the file connection in which to store duplicate files"
configItems.config_group: SFTP Polling Workflow Creation Duplicate File Handling

configItems.name: sftp-polling-duplicate-workflow-name
configItems.description: "the name of the workflow for duplicate file handling; if not set (the default), no workflow order will be created; only used if "sftp-polling-file-connection" and "sftp-polling-duplicate-order-mapper" are also set"
configItems.config_group: SFTP Polling Workflow Creation Duplicate File Handling

configItems.name: sftp-polling-duplicate-workflow-version
configItems.description: the version of the workflow for duplicate file handling; if not set (the default), the latest version will be used"
configItems.config_group: SFTP Polling Workflow Creation Duplicate File Handling

configItems.name: sftp-polling-duplicate-order-mapper
configItems.description: "the mapper for creating duplicate orders, only used if "sftp-polling-file-connection" and "sftp-polling-duplicate-order-mapper" are also set; the local file path is available as "$local:local_path" and if "sftp-polling-duplicate-file-connection" is set, then the new name is available as "$local:new_name""
configItems.config_group: SFTP Polling Workflow Creation Duplicate File Handling

configItems.name: create-workflow-output-data
configItems.description:
the configuration of output data for `UserApi::updateOutputData()`; the output data includes the following keys:
- `name` (string): the name of the file polled
- `size` (int): the size of the file in bytes
- `uid` (int): the UID of the owner of the file
- `gid` (int): the GID of the owner of the file
- `mode` (string): the permissions / mode of the file
- `atime` (date): the last accessed date/time of the file
- `mtime` (date): the last modified date/time of the file
- `type` (string): the type of file; one of: `REGULAR`, `DIRECTORY`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `BLOCK-DEVICE`, `CHARACTER-DEVICE`, `FIFO`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `SOCKET`, or `UNKNOWN`
- `perm` (string): a string giving UNIX-style permissions for the file (ex: `-rwxr-xr-x`)
- `data` (binary): this key is only present if `sftp-polling-file-connection` not set; in this case the remote file data is retrieved in memory and stored in this key as binary data
- `filepath` (string): the remote filepath relative to SFTP root directory
- `order_status` (string): the status of the new order created (`READY` or `BLOCKED`)
- `workflow_instanceid` (int): the ID of the new workflow order
- `duplicate` (bool): a boolean value indicating if the order is a duplicate order (only `True` if `create-workflow-duplicate-handling` = `SUCCESS`)

If `sftp-polling-file-connection` is set, the output data includes the following keys:
- `local_path` (string): the target path for the file where the file will be moved to in the post event action
- `tmp_filename` (string): the temporary filename used to store the file until the post action
- `tmp_path` (string): the current temporary path on the filesystem of the file
- `transfer_time` (date): a relative date/time value giving the time it took to transfer the file

Values should have the format:
`output-data-key: location-template`

For example:
```
workflow_instanceid: '$dynamic:order-id'
```
Will store the `workflow_instanceid` of the order created in the `order-id` key in workflow dynamic data.

**NOTE**: See [Config Item / Building Block Template Substitution Strings](https://qoretechnologies.com/manual/qorus/current/qorus/commonserverapi.html#bb_template_strings) for more information on template strings; any output location valid for the current context can be used to store output data

configItems.name: create-workflow-specific-unique-key
configItems.description:
An optional hash of order keys that will ensure uniqueness for a particular workflow (workflowid or name and version); the keys in this hash must correspond to registered workflow order keys, the values are one or more key values.  These keys can be used to quickly search for workflow order data.
If a workflow order for the same exact workflow (workflowid) has one of the given key/value combinations already, then the workflow order creation duplicate logic will be triggered.

For resolving template values `$local:input` is a hash with the following values:

- `name` (string): the name of the file polled
- `size` (int): the size of the file in bytes
- `uid` (int): the UID of the owner of the file
- `gid` (int): the GID of the owner of the file
- `mode` (string): the permissions / mode of the file
- `atime` (date): the last accessed date/time of the file
- `mtime` (date): the last modified date/time of the file
- `type` (string): the type of file; one of: `REGULAR`, `DIRECTORY`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `BLOCK-DEVICE`, `CHARACTER-DEVICE`, `FIFO`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `SOCKET`, or `UNKNOWN`
- `perm` (string): a string giving UNIX-style permissions for the file (ex: `-rwxr-xr-x`)
- `data` (binary): this key is only present if `sftp-polling-file-connection` not set; in this case the remote file data is retrieved in memory and stored in this key as binary data
- `filepath` (string): the remote filepath relative to SFTP root directory
- `order_status` (string): the status of the new order created (`READY` or `BLOCKED`)
- `workflow_instanceid` (int): the ID of the new workflow order
- `duplicate` (bool): a boolean value indicating if the order is a duplicate order (only `True` if `create-workflow-duplicate-handling` = `SUCCESS`)

If `sftp-polling-file-connection` is set, the `$local:input` includes the following keys:
- `local_path` (string): the target path for the file where the file will be moved to in the post event action
- `tmp_filename` (string): the temporary filename used to store the file until the post action
- `tmp_path` (string): the current temporary path on the filesystem of the file
- `transfer_time` (date): a relative date/time value giving the time it took to transfer the file

The workflow order scheduled date; if this value is set, then the order cannot be processed before the given date/time value.

For resolving template values `$local:input` is a hash with the following values:

- `name` (string): the name of the file polled
- `size` (int): the size of the file in bytes
- `uid` (int): the UID of the owner of the file
- `gid` (int): the GID of the owner of the file
- `mode` (string): the permissions / mode of the file
- `atime` (date): the last accessed date/time of the file
- `mtime` (date): the last modified date/time of the file
- `type` (string): the type of file; one of: `REGULAR`, `DIRECTORY`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `BLOCK-DEVICE`, `CHARACTER-DEVICE`, `FIFO`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `SOCKET`, or `UNKNOWN`
- `perm` (string): a string giving UNIX-style permissions for the file (ex: `-rwxr-xr-x`)
- `data` (binary): this key is only present if `sftp-polling-file-connection` not set; in this case the remote file data is retrieved in memory and stored in this key as binary data
- `filepath` (string): the remote filepath relative to SFTP root directory
- `order_status` (string): the status of the new order created (`READY` or `BLOCKED`)
- `workflow_instanceid` (int): the ID of the new workflow order
- `duplicate` (bool): a boolean value indicating if the order is a duplicate order (only `True` if `create-workflow-duplicate-handling` = `SUCCESS`)

If `sftp-polling-file-connection` is set, the `$local:input` includes the following keys:
- `local_path` (string): the target path for the file where the file will be moved to in the post event action
- `tmp_filename` (string): the temporary filename used to store the file until the post action
- `tmp_path` (string): the current temporary path on the filesystem of the file
- `transfer_time` (date): a relative date/time value giving the time it took to transfer the file

An optional hash of order keys that will ensure uniqueness for a particular workflow (workflowid or name and version); the keys in this hash must correspond to registered workflow order keys, the values are one or more key values.  These keys can be used to quickly search for workflow order data.
If a workflow order for the same exact workflow (workflowid) has one of the given key/value combinations already, then the workflow order creation duplicate logic will be triggered.

An optional hash of order keys that will ensure uniqueness across all workflows in the given Qorus instance; the keys in this hash must correspond to registered workflow order keys, the values are one or more key values. These keys can be used to quickly search for workflow order data.
If a workflow order already exists with one of the given key/value combinations already, then the workflow order creation duplicate logic will be triggered.

data.desc:
## Summary

Base class for running a mapper with a request/response-based output data provider in autonomous mode, meaning that the input and output data are provided by data providers configured in the mapper.  This building block also supports recovery logic and a validation connector.

This building block is not suitable for mapping input data and returning output data, for that use `BBM_GenericMapper` or a mapper in an FSM, a data pipeline, or in a class connection in an interface.

Use this object's configuration to provide input or search filtering as well as to tune the output data handling.

## Connectors

### Input/Output Connector `runMapper`

This connector runs the mapper in autonomous mode.

Local data for the call to `UserApi::expandTemplatedValue()` is the input argument data for the connector available as `$local:input`.

### Input/Output Connector `validate`

This connector is suitable for step validation logic; it returns a string providing the validation status, either `COMPLETE` or `RETRY`, depending if output data was found in the output data provider or not.

Local data for the call to `UserApi::expandTemplatedValue()` is the input argument data for the connector available as `$local:input`.

## References

See `BBM_GenericMapper`

configItems.description: any options to output providers using the request/response API

configItems.description: The name of any mapper to use when recovering

data.desc: Class for making a transaction-safe REST request
data.name: BBM_RestActionWithRecovery
data.short_desc: Class for making a transaction-safe REST request
author: Qore Technologies, s.r.o.

configItems.name: rest-connection-name
configItems.description: the name of the REST connection

configItems.name: rest-method
configItems.description: the REST method to use

configItems.name: rest-api-mapper-name
configItems.description: the name of the mapper for the REST call; if no value is set, then no payload will be included; do not set with a GET request

configItems.name: rest-uri-path
configItems.description: the URI path for creating the request(s) in the REST server

configItems.name: rest-id-location
configItems.description: location in the response for the unique ID; if this config item is set and no value is found in the response at the location given here, then an exception is thrown

configItems.name: rest-headers
configItems.description: additional headers to send with each REST request

configItems.name: rest-swagger-schema-location
configItems.description: the location of the Swagger schema for the REST connection; this will be resolved by calling `UserApi::getTextFileFromLocation()`

configItems.name: rest-body-remove-nulls
configItems.description: if true then any empty key values returned by the mapper will be removed before sending the request to the server

configItems.name: rest-output-data
configItems.description: the configuration of output data; the REST response hash is passed as input to the `UserApi::updateOutputData()` method; the deserialized REST response body is located in the `body` key of this hash; if *rest-id-location* is configured, then the value retrieved can be referenced with key `rest-id` in the output data hash

configItems.name: rest-id-log-msg
configItems.description: a string giving a log message for successful retrieval of the ID identified by *rest-id-location*; this ID can be referred to as `$local:{rest-id}` in the template string

configItems.name: rest-supports-recovery
configItems.description: set to `true` if the request requires and supports recovery, `false` if not; if `true` then `rest-recovery-uri` and at least one of `rest-id-location` and/or `rest-recovery-id-location` or `rest-recovery-response-location` must be set

configItems.name: rest-recovery-uri
configItems.description: the URI path for the recovery request to the REST server; must be set if `rest-supports-recovery` is set to `true`

configItems.name: rest-recovery-id-location
configItems.description: the location of the unique ID for the record in the REST recovery response; conflicts with `rest-recovery-response-location`; if not set and `rest-id-location` is set, then `rest-id-location` will be used for this value

configItems.name: rest-recovery-response-location
configItems.description: the location of the recovery value in the recovery response message to check; the value to check must be set with `rest-recovery-response-value`; conflicts with `rest-recovery-id-location`; only used if `rest-id-location` is not set; the value here is related to the entire HTTP response; prefix with `body.` to compare values in the response message body (ex: `body.account.ID`)

configItems.name: rest-recovery-response-value
configItems.description: the value to compare against the value given by `rest-recovery-response-location`; must be set with `rest-recovery-response-location`; conflicts with `rest-recovery-id-location`; only used if `rest-id-location` is not set

configItems.name: rest-recovery-output-data
configItems.description:
The configuration of output data taking the recovery message on input; the REST recovery response hash is passed as input to the `UserApi::updateOutputData()` method.

The deserialized REST response body is located in the `body` key of this hash; if `rest-id-location` or `rest-recovery-id-location` is configured, then the value retrieved can be referenced with key `rest-id` in the output data hash.

**Note**: If this configuration item is not set, and `rest-output-data` is set, then `rest-output-data` will be used instead (for example in case the original message response is identical to the recovery message response)

configItems.name: rest-recovery-id-log-msg
configItems.description: a string giving a log message for successful retrieval of the ID identified by `rest-recovery-id-location` or `rest-id-location`; this ID can be referred to as `$local:{rest-id}` in the template string
configItems.default_value: REST RECOVERY response sucessfully retrieved ID: $local:{rest-id}

configItems.name: rest-body
configItems.description: The message body for the request; if a mapper is also set, this will be used as the input for the mapper.

configItems.name: rest-action-retries
configItems.description: Number of times a REST action will be retried if a connection error is encountered; if this number is <=0, then no retries are made

configItems.name: rest-action-retry-delay
configItems.description: The retry delay in number of seconds; only takes effect if `rest-action-retries` is > 0

configItems.name: rest-action-retry-errors
configItems.description: The list of error codes that result in a retry of the REST operation if `rest-action-retries` > 0

data.desc:
## Summary

Building block class for polling for files from an SFTP server and creating a workflow order from files polled.

The local context data for the internal workflow order creation call is the file event data as described by data type `qoretechnologies/building-blocks/sftp/event`; therefore this information can be used when creating the order; for example `create-workflow-staticdata` = `$local:*` would set the initial static order data to the file event hash.

Duplicates can be detected from order keys, i.e. if one of the following config items is used:
- `create-workflow-specific-unique-key`
- `create-workflow-unique-key`
- `create-workflow-global-unique-key`

In this case this object also contains configuration that allows for an alternative "duplicate-file-handling" workflow order to be created.  See config items in the **SFTP Polling Workflow Creation Duplicate File Handling** group for more information.

## References

See `BBM_SftpPollerCreateOrderJob` for a class designed to be used as the base class for a job
data.name: BBM_SftpPollerCreateOrder
author: Qore Technologies, s.r.o.

configItems.name: sftp-polling-connection-name
configItems.description: the name of the SFTP connection

configItems.name: sftp-polling-mask
configItems.description: the filename mask for files to match when polling; is a regular expression if `sftp-polling-mask-regex` is set; if not, then this value is a glob value

configItems.name: sftp-polling-mask-regex
configItems.description: if `sftp-polling-mask` is a regular expression or not

configItems.name: sftp-polling-regex-options
configItems.description: regular expression options for SFTP polling; only used if `sftp-polling-mask-regex` is true

configItems.name: sftp-polling-file-connection
configItems.description: the name of a local file connection where to save files; `sftp-polling-file-name` can be set to give a subdirectory path offset from the connection; note that if this configuration item is not set, then files are retrieved to memory, this should only be done for relatively small files; if files can be large, then it's recommended to set this option and process files directly from the filesystem

configItems.name: sftp-polling-file-name
configItems.description: a template string giving the target local file name as offset from the connection identified with `sftp-polling-file-connection`; ignored if `sftp-polling-file-connection` is not set; local context includes the event information (ex: `subdir/$local:name`)

configItems.name: sftp-polling-file-temp-template
configItems.description: the template for the temporary filename used while transferring the file, the file event info is added to the local context (ex: the target filename is available as `$local:name`)

configItems.name: sftp-polling-minage
configItems.description: the minimum age of the file in seconds before it will be visible to the poller

configItems.name: sftp-polling-encoding
configItems.description: the character encoding for any text files received

configItems.name: sftp-polling-delete-file
configItems.description: if true then files will be deleted after the polling action has been executed on them; if false then `sftp-polling-move-target` must be set

configItems.name: sftp-polling-move-target
configItems.description: the directory and target filename for moving / renaming files after the polling action has been executed, only used if `sftp-polling-delete-file` is false; file event info is added to the local context (ex: `complete/$local:{name}`)"

configItems.name: sftp-polling-interval-secs
configItems.description:
The polling interval in seconds for when this class is used in a service with the `start` and `stop` and `sftpFileEvent` connectors.

This config item is only used when this class is used in the background polling thread in a Qorus service with the above-mentioned connectors; it is ignored in all other cases.

configItems.name: create-workflow-name
configItems.description:
The name of the workflow.

For resolving template values `$local:input` is a hash with the following values:

- `name` (string): the name of the file polled
- `size` (int): the size of the file in bytes
- `uid` (int): the UID of the owner of the file
- `gid` (int): the GID of the owner of the file
- `mode` (string): the permissions / mode of the file
- `atime` (date): the last accessed date/time of the file
- `mtime` (date): the last modified date/time of the file
- `type` (string): the type of file; one of: `REGULAR`, `DIRECTORY`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `BLOCK-DEVICE`, `CHARACTER-DEVICE`, `FIFO`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `SOCKET`, or `UNKNOWN`
- `perm` (string): a string giving UNIX-style permissions for the file (ex: `-rwxr-xr-x`)
- `data` (binary): this key is only present if `sftp-polling-file-connection` not set; in this case the remote file data is retrieved in memory and stored in this key as binary data
- `filepath` (string): the remote filepath relative to SFTP root directory
- `order_status` (string): the status of the new order created (`READY` or `BLOCKED`)
- `workflow_instanceid` (int): the ID of the new workflow order
- `duplicate` (bool): a boolean value indicating if the order is a duplicate order (only `True` if `create-workflow-duplicate-handling` = `SUCCESS`)

If `sftp-polling-file-connection` is set, the `$local:input` includes the following keys:
- `local_path` (string): the target path for the file where the file will be moved to in the post event action
- `tmp_filename` (string): the temporary filename used to store the file until the post action
- `tmp_path` (string): the current temporary path on the filesystem of the file
- `transfer_time` (date): a relative date/time value giving the time it took to transfer the file

configItems.name: create-workflow-version
configItems.description:
The version of the workflow; if not set (the default), the latest version will be used.

For resolving template values `$local:input` is a hash with the following values:

- `name` (string): the name of the file polled
- `size` (int): the size of the file in bytes
- `uid` (int): the UID of the owner of the file
- `gid` (int): the GID of the owner of the file
- `mode` (string): the permissions / mode of the file
- `atime` (date): the last accessed date/time of the file
- `mtime` (date): the last modified date/time of the file
- `type` (string): the type of file; one of: `REGULAR`, `DIRECTORY`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `BLOCK-DEVICE`, `CHARACTER-DEVICE`, `FIFO`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `SOCKET`, or `UNKNOWN`
- `perm` (string): a string giving UNIX-style permissions for the file (ex: `-rwxr-xr-x`)
- `data` (binary): this key is only present if `sftp-polling-file-connection` not set; in this case the remote file data is retrieved in memory and stored in this key as binary data
- `filepath` (string): the remote filepath relative to SFTP root directory
- `order_status` (string): the status of the new order created (`READY` or `BLOCKED`)
- `workflow_instanceid` (int): the ID of the new workflow order
- `duplicate` (bool): a boolean value indicating if the order is a duplicate order (only `True` if `create-workflow-duplicate-handling` = `SUCCESS`)

If `sftp-polling-file-connection` is set, the `$local:input` includes the following keys:
- `local_path` (string): the target path for the file where the file will be moved to in the post event action
- `tmp_filename` (string): the temporary filename used to store the file until the post action
- `tmp_path` (string): the current temporary path on the filesystem of the file
- `transfer_time` (date): a relative date/time value giving the time it took to transfer the file

configItems.name: create-workflow-output-data
configItems.description:
the configuration of output data for `UserApi::updateOutputData()`; the output data includes the following keys:
- `name` (string): the name of the file polled
- `size` (int): the size of the file in bytes
- `uid` (int): the UID of the owner of the file
- `gid` (int): the GID of the owner of the file
- `mode` (string): the permissions / mode of the file
- `atime` (date): the last accessed date/time of the file
- `mtime` (date): the last modified date/time of the file
- `type` (string): the type of file; one of: `REGULAR`, `DIRECTORY`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `BLOCK-DEVICE`, `CHARACTER-DEVICE`, `FIFO`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `SOCKET`, or `UNKNOWN`
- `perm` (string): a string giving UNIX-style permissions for the file (ex: `-rwxr-xr-x`)
- `data` (binary): this key is only present if `sftp-polling-file-connection` not set; in this case the remote file data is retrieved in memory and stored in this key as binary data
- `filepath` (string): the remote filepath relative to SFTP root directory
- `order_status` (string): the status of the new order created (`READY` or `BLOCKED`)
- `workflow_instanceid` (int): the ID of the new workflow order
- `duplicate` (bool): a boolean value indicating if the order is a duplicate order (only `True` if `create-workflow-duplicate-handling` = `SUCCESS`)

If `sftp-polling-file-connection` is set, the output data includes the following keys:
- `local_path` (string): the target path for the file where the file will be moved to in the post event action
- `tmp_filename` (string): the temporary filename used to store the file until the post action
- `tmp_path` (string): the current temporary path on the filesystem of the file
- `transfer_time` (date): a relative date/time value giving the time it took to transfer the file

Values should have the format:
`output-data-key: location-template`

For example:
```
workflow_instanceid: '$dynamic:order-id'
```
Will store the `workflow_instanceid` of the order created in the `order-id` key in workflow dynamic data.

**NOTE**: See [Config Item / Building Block Template Substitution Strings](https://qoretechnologies.com/manual/qorus/current/qorus/commonserverapi.html#bb_template_strings) for more information on template strings; any output location valid for the current context can be used to store output data

configItems.name: create-workflow-specific-unique-key
configItems.description:
An optional hash of order keys that will ensure uniqueness for a particular workflow (workflowid or name and version); the keys in this hash must correspond to registered workflow order keys, the values are one or more key values.  These keys can be used to quickly search for workflow order data.
If a workflow order for the same exact workflow (workflowid) has one of the given key/value combinations already, then the workflow order creation duplicate logic will be triggered.

For resolving template values `$local:input` is a hash with the following values:

- `name` (string): the name of the file polled
- `size` (int): the size of the file in bytes
- `uid` (int): the UID of the owner of the file
- `gid` (int): the GID of the owner of the file
- `mode` (string): the permissions / mode of the file
- `atime` (date): the last accessed date/time of the file
- `mtime` (date): the last modified date/time of the file
- `type` (string): the type of file; one of: `REGULAR`, `DIRECTORY`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `BLOCK-DEVICE`, `CHARACTER-DEVICE`, `FIFO`, `SYMBOLIC-LINK`, `SOCKET`, or `UNKNOWN`
- `perm` (string): a string giving UNIX-style permissions for the file (ex: `-rwxr-xr-x`)
- `data` (binary): this key is only present if `sftp-polling-file-connection` not set; in this case the remote file data is retrieved in memory and stored in this key as binary data
- `filepath` (string): the remote filepath relative to SFTP root directory
- `order_status` (string): the status of the new order created (`READY` or `BLOCKED`)
- `workflow_instanceid` (int): the ID of the new workflow order
- `duplicate` (bool): a boolean value indicating if the order is a duplicate order (only `True` if `create-workflow-duplicate-handling` = `SUCCESS`)

If `sftp-polling-file-connection` is set, the `$local:input` includes the following keys:
- `local_path` (string): the target path for the file where the file will be moved to in the post event action
- `tmp_filename` (string): the temporary filename used to store the file until the post action
- `tmp_path` (string): the current temporary path on the filesystem of the file
- `transfer_time` (date): a relative date/time value giving the time it took to transfer the file
