data.desc: Rotates log files and optionally handles moving and compressing old log files
data.name: qorus-log-rotator
data.short_desc: Rotates log files and optionally handles moving and compressing old log files
author: Qore Technologies, s.r.o.

config-items.name: qorus-log-archive-dir
config-items.description:
The directory where to move archived log files after rotation.

If this config item has no value, then files will not be moved after rotation.

If set and the path is not absolute, then the path will be relative to the Qorus log directory.

config-items.name: qorus-log-compression
config-items.description:
The compression algorithm to use for log files:
- `BZ2`: [bzip2](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bzip2) compression; filename extension: `.bz2`
- `GZ`: gzip compression ([RFC 1952](http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1952.txt)); filename excension: `.gz`
- `NONE`: no compression; no changes to file name
- `Z`: zlib-based  *deflate* data compression ([RFC 1951](http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1951.txt)); filename extension: `.Z`

config-items.name: qorus-log-retention-days
config-items.description:
The number of days that archived or already rotated log files will be kept.

If this config item has a value, then any archived files or rotated log files will be deleted if they have a creation date older than this value as a number of days from the current date.

config-items.name: qorus-log-process-old-files
config-items.description:
If this config item is set to `true` (the default), then all files that still exist after rotation are assumed to be log files and will be rotated manually.

This allows for handling log files for interfaces no longer running when the log rotation action is executed, however it also means that all files in the log directory will be treated as log files.

data.desc: test for the CSV read base building block
data.name: bb-csv-read-base-job
data.short_desc: test for the CSV read base building block
author: Qore Technologies, s.r.o.

config-items.name: csv-read-path
config-items.description: The path to the Csv data; mutually exclusive with `csv-read-stream`
config-items.config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Main Options

config-items.name: csv-read-stream
config-items.description: A Java or Qore `InputStream` object providing the CSV data; mutually exclusive with `csv-read-path`
config-items.config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Main Options

config-items.name: csv-read-tolwr
config-items.description: If `true` then all automatically-detected header names will be converted to lower case.
config-items.config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Header Options

config-items.name: csv-read-header-lines
config-items.description: The number of header lines in the CSV data
config-items.config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Header Options

config-items.name: csv-read-header-names
config-items.description: if `true` then the object will parse the header names from the first header row, in this case if `header_cells` is not set explicitly, it will be assumed to be `1`
config-items.config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Header Options

config-items.name: csv-read-header-reorder
config-items.description: if `true` (the default) then if `headers` are provided, then data fields are reordered to follow headers config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Header Options

config-items.name: csv-read-headers
config-items.description: The ist of header / column names for the data iterated; if this is present, then `header_names` must be `false`
config-items.config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Header Options

config-items.name: csv-read-eol
config-items.description:
The end of line characters used in the input data.

If not set the end of line characters will be automatically detected.
config-items.config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Field Options

config-items.name: csv-read-fields
config-items.description: The fields in the CSV data; keys are field names as given by the `header_names` or `headers` options (in case neither of these options are used, then field names are numbers starting with `0`) and the values are either strings (one of `bool`, `int`, `float`, `number`, `string`, `date`, optionally prefixed by `*` if the value is optional) or a hash describing the field; also sets `headers` if not set automatically with `header_names`; if no field type is given, the default is `*string`; note that invalid field names given in this option are ignored
config-items.config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Field Options

config-items.name: csv-read-separator
config-items.description: The string separating the fields in the file (default: `,`).
config-items.config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Field Options

config-items.name: csv-read-quote
config-items.description: the field quote character (default: `\"`)
config-items.config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Field Options

config-items.name: csv-read-verify-columns
config-items.description: if `true` (default `false`), if a line is parsed with a different column or field count than other lines, an exception is raised
config-items.config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Field Options

config-items.name: csv-read-date-format
config-items.description:
The date format to use when parsing date/time values (ex: `DD.MM.YYYY`).

If not set then ISO-8601 format is assumed (i.e. `YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS`)
config-items.config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Data Options

config-items.name: csv-read-encoding
config-items.description:
The character encoding used for the input data.

If not set then \c UTF-8 is assumed
config-items.config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Data Options

config-items.name: csv-read-ignore-empty
config-items.description: if `true` then empty lines will be ignored
config-items.config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Data Options

config-items.name: csv-read-ignore-whitespace
config-items.description: if `true`, leading and trailing whitespace will be stripped from non-quoted field
config-items.config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Data Options

config-items.name: csv-read-number-format
config-items.description: the default format for `int`, `float`, and `number` fields as a string giving the thousands separator character followed by the decimal separator character (ex: `.,` for continental-European-style numbers)
config-items.config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Data Options

config-items.name: csv-read-timezone
config-items.description:
The timezone region to use when creating date/time values (ex: `Europe/Prague`).

If not set then all dates are assumed to be in the server's time zone.
config-items.config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Data Options

config-items.name: csv-read-search-where
config-items.description: Search "where" criteria for the `searchRecords` connector
config-items.config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Search Options

config-items.name: csv-read-search-options
config-items.description: Search options for the `searchRecords` connector
config-items.config_group: CSV Read Data Provider Search Options

config-items.name: output-data-hash
config-items.description:
A hash where keys describe the data, and the values describe the target location for the data.

Keys will be processed with `UserApi::expandTemplatedValue()`; ex:
```
{"$info:started": "$pstate:last_execution_date"}
```

In a job, this will store the `started` info attribute into the `last_execution_date` key of the job's persistent state data.

config-items.name: create-workflow-order-mapper
config-items.description: the name of the mapper to create the workflow order data

config-items.name: create-workflow-name
config-items.description: the name of the workflow

config-items.name: create-workflow-version
config-items.description: the version of the workflow; if not set (the default), the latest version will be used

config-items.name: create-workflow-duplicate-handling
config-items.description:
how should workflows with duplicate unique keys be handled:
 - `SUCCESS`: the workflow order instance ID is returned normally
 - `DUPLICATE`: the `DUPLICATE-ORDER-KEY` exception is rethrown

config-items.name: create-workflow-output-data
config-items.description:
the configuration of output data for `UserApi::updateOutputData()`; the output data will include a `workflow_instanceid` key with the ID created for the new workflow order and a `duplicate` key with a boolean value indicating if the order is a duplicate order (only `True` if `create-workflow-duplicate-handling` = `SUCCESS`

Values should have the format:
`data: location`

For example:
```
workflow_instanceid: '$dynamic:order-id'
```
Will store the `workflow_instanceid` of the order created in the `order-id` key in workflow dynamic data.

config-items.name: dataprovider-create-provider-path
config-items.description: the path to the data provider to use to create the record; must identify a record-based data provider

config-items.name: dataprovider-create-input
config-items.description: the value for the record; either this item or *dataprovider-create-mapper* (or both) must be provided to specify the record; the input data type must be either `hash` or a list of hashes or a runtime error will be raised (`INVALID-INPUT`)

config-items.name: dataprovider-create-mapper
config-items.description: the name of the mapper; either this item or *dataprovider-create-input* (or both) must be provided to specify the record

config-items.name: dataprovider-create-options
config-items.description: Any record creation options; in case `dataprovider-create-upsert` is `true` then these will be data provider upsert options instead of creation options

config-items.name: dataprovider-create-duplicate-handling
config-items.description:
how should calls with duplicate errors be handled:
 - `SUCCESS`: the call succeeds
 - `DUPLICATE`: the `DUPLICATE-ERROR` exception is rethrown

config-items.name: dataprovider-create-output-data
config-items.description: the configuration of output data; the record data as input to the `UserApi::updateOutputData()` method; note that if a list of input records is provided, the output list will be found in the `data` key of the output hash

config-items.name: dataprovider-create-upsert
config-items.description: If `true` then upsert operations will be performed rather than create operations; also in this case the output values will be the same as the input data

config-items.name: rest-connection-name
config-items.description: the name of the REST connection

config-items.name: rest-method
config-items.description: the REST method to use

config-items.name: rest-api-mapper-name
config-items.description: the name of the mapper for the REST call; if no value is set, then no payload will be included; do not set with a GET request

config-items.name: rest-uri-path
config-items.description: the URI path for creating the request(s) in the REST server

config-items.name: rest-id-location
config-items.description: location in the response for the unique ID; if this config item is set and no value is found in the response at the location given here, then an exception is thrown

config-items.name: rest-headers
config-items.description: additional headers to send with each REST request

config-items.name: rest-swagger-schema-location
config-items.description: the location of the Swagger schema for the REST connection; this will be resolved by calling `UserApi::getTextFileFromLocation()`

config-items.name: rest-body-remove-nulls
config-items.description: if true then any empty key values returned by the mapper will be removed before sending the request to the server

config-items.name: rest-output-data
config-items.description: the configuration of output data; the REST response hash is passed as input to the `UserApi::updateOutputData()` method; the deserialized REST response body is located in the `body` key of this hash; if *rest-id-location* is configured, then the value retrieved can be referenced with key `rest-id` in the output data hash

config-items.name: rest-id-log-msg

config-items.description: The name of an SMTP server connection that will be used to send the email

config-items.name: smtp-from
config-items.description: The sender's email address

config-items.name: smtp-subject
config-items.description: The email subject

config-items.name: smtp-to
config-items.description:
One or more `To:` addresses for the email; note that the data type for this config item is a list.

At least one address for `smtp-to`, `smtp-cc`, or `smtp-bcc` must be set.

config-items.name: smtp-cc
config-items.description:
One or more `cc:` addresses for the email; note that the data type for this config item is a list.

At least one address for `smtp-to`, `smtp-cc`, or `smtp-bcc` must be set.

config-items.name: smtp-bcc
config-items.description:
One or more `bcc:` (blind carbon copy) addresses for the email; note that the data type for this config item is a list.

At least one address for `smtp-to`, `smtp-cc`, or `smtp-bcc` must be set.

config-items.name: smtp-body
config-items.description: The message body to send; must be either a string or a binary value.

config-items.name: smtp-body-encoding
config-items.description:
The encoding for the message body, may be:
- `default`: means `quoted-printable` for a string, `base64` for a binary body
- `base64` base 64 encoding
- `quoted-printablt`: quoted printable encoding
- `none`: no encoding

config-items.name: smtp-body-content-type
config-items.description: The MIME type for the message body

config-items.name: smtp-attachments
config-items.description:
A list of hashes giving information for message attachments.

Each hash in the list can have the following keys:
- `name`: (string) required; the attachment name / file name
- `mime`: (string) required; the attachment MIME type
- `data`: (string or binary) required; the attachment data
- `encoding` (string) optional one of the following values:
  - `default`: means `base64` for binary attachments, `quoted-printable` for string attachments
  - `base64`: base 64 encoding
  - `quoted-printable`: quoted printable encoding
  - `none`: no encoding
- `headers`: any MIME headers for the attachment

config-items.name: smtp-important
config-items.description: A flag that determines if the `Important` flag is set on the message

config-items.name: smtp-delivery-receipt
config-items.description: A flag that determines if the `ReceiptDelivery` flag is set on the message

config-items.name: smtp-read-receipt
config-items.description: A flag that determines if the `ReceiptRead` flag is set on the message

Keys will be processed with `UserApi::expandTemplatedValue()`; ex:

config-items.name: mqtt-paho-message-qos
config-items.description:
Sets the quality of service for this message.

- `0`: Quality of Service 0 - indicates that a message should be delivered at most once (zero or one times). The message will not be persisted to disk, and will not be acknowledged across the network. This QoS is the fastest, but should only be used for messages which are not valuable - note that if the server cannot process the message (for example, there is an authorization problem), then an `MqttCallback.deliveryComplete(IMqttDeliveryToken)`. Also known as *"fire and forget"*.
- `1`: Quality of Service 1 - indicates that a message should be delivered at least once (one or more times). The message can only be delivered safely if it can be persisted, so the application must supply a means of persistence using `MqttConnectOptions`. If a persistence mechanism is not specified, the message will not be delivered in the event of a client failure. The message will be acknowledged across the network. This is the default QoS.
- `2`: Quality of Service 2 - indicates that a message should be delivered once. The message will be persisted to disk, and will be subject to a two-phase acknowledgement across the network. The message can only be delivered safely if it can be persisted, so the application must supply a means of persistence using `MqttConnectOptions`. If a persistence mechanism is not specified, the message will not be delivered in the event of a client failure.
If persistence is not configured, QoS 1 and 2 messages will still be delivered in the event of a network or server problem as the client will hold state in memory. If the MQTT client is shutdown or fails and persistence is not configured then delivery of QoS 1 and 2 messages can not be maintained as client-side state will be lost.

config-items.name: mqtt-paho-message-topic
config-items.description: The topic for the message to send

config-items.name: mqtt-paho-message-body
config-items.description:
The message body to send; will be converted to a binary and then published.

When using the `publish` connector with dynamic input data, this config item is ignored.

config-items.name: excel-read-data-cells
config-items.description:
The range of cells for data to process;  this can one of the following options:
- a range of rows: ex **1:20**
- a range of specific cells: ex **B2:K20**

If this value is not provided, then data processing starts at the first row of the spreadsheet or the first row of the spreadsheet after the last header row, and columns are detected automatically; the first empty cell is used as the end of data for the row.

config-items.name: excel-read-header-cells
config-items.description:
The range of cells for headers; possible values are:
- a single row number: ex **1**
- a range of row numbers: ex **2:5**
- a range of cells: ex **A1:H1**

When using row numbers, header cells are detected automatically; the first empty cell signals the end of header data.

config-items.name: excel-read-header-names
config-items.description: if `true` then the object will parse the header names from the first header row, in this case if `header_cells` is not set explicitly, it will be assumed to be `1`

config-items.name: excel-read-headers
config-items.description: The ist of header / column names for the data iterated; if this is present, then `header_names` must be `false`

config-items.name: excel-read-path
config-items.description: The path to the Excel data; mutually exclusive with `stream`

config-items.name: excel-read-stream
config-items.description: A Java or Qore `InputStream` object providing the binary Excel spreadsheet data; mutually exclusive with `path`

config-items.name: excel-read-timezone
config-items.description:
The timezone region to use when creating date/time values (ex: `Europe/Prague`).

If not set then all dates are assumed to be in the server's time zone.

config-items.name: excel-read-tolwr
config-items.description: If `true` then all automatically-detected header names will be converted to lower case.

config-items.name: excel-read-worksheet
config-items.description: The name of the worksheet to process; if missing, the first worksheet is used

config-items.name: excel-read-search-where
config-items.description: Search "where" criteria for the `searchRecords` connector
